RC1

Also saw this in the log (with no trace)

JUnitWithAnt does not exist.

Fixed. Changes in AppletLaunchConfigurationUtils. We were returning null when 
all clients expected a collection - returning an empty collection instead.
*** Bug 65746 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Verified.

While verifying this, I noticed that we can't launch a Java type with a main from a non-Java project. I 
tried updating our launch shortcut to handle an ICompilationUnit, but our call to SearchEngine.
searchMainTypes() comes back empty in this case. Martin (or Darin), is this a bug or are you just out of 
luck outside a Java project?

I don't think we can do much here - we can't compute a default classpath 
anyway (i.e. there's no buildpath). The user pretty much has to set up a 
custom config. Perhaps we should not show the shortcuts for non-Java projects 
though (could be a new enhancement).
